name: Crossing Way
origin: Ao no Kanata no Four Rhythm
desc:
The song played during the grand opening for Sprite's visual novel Aokana: Four Rhythms Across the Blue.

You can purchase a digital copy of the game on NekoNyanSoft's website. A few portions of the game contain adult content, so be advised. An all-ages version is available on Steam, too, at the time of writing.

Credit goes to Sprite for the song and the art used.

name: Great at Crime
desc:
The ending credits theme song for the first several episodes of Brendan "JelloApocalypse" Blaber's miniseries Epithet Erased

You can watch the series for free on Blaber's YouTube channel.

Credit goes to Plasterbrain, JelloApocalypse, and those involved in the making of Epithet Erased for the song and the art used.

name: ECA Attraction Theme
desc:
This song plays during the cutscene from the attraction mode of the 1999 Sega arcade game Emergency Call Ambulance.

Information for this game is rather sparse, but it surviving arcade cabinets and boards exist, and it may be played on the appropriate emulator. Gameplay can also be found on YouTube.

Credit goes to Sega for the song and the art used.

name: Great Big Rollin' Railroad
desc:
Written by C. W. McCall, this song was created for use in an advertising campaign by the UPRR in 1970. It was well-received by the railroad company, who proceeded to use it in all their TV commercials and in other events.

Art based on a photograph taken by Hellbus, licensed under CC BY-SA 3.0. Credit goes to the UPRR and C. W. McCall for the song.

name: DEADLINE
desc:
The opening theme song for Brendan "JelloApocalypse" Blaber's miniseries Epithet Erased.

You can watch the series for free on Blaber's YouTube channel.

Credit goes to Plasterbrain, JelloApocalypse, and those involved in the making of Epithet Erased for the song and the art used.

name: My Place
desc:
The leitmotif for Natsume Rindou, a character from Lump of Sugar's 2010 visual novel Hello, Good-bye.

You can purchase a digital copy of the game on NekoNyanSoft's website. A few portions of the game contain adult content, so be advised. An all-ages version is available on Steam, too, at the time of writing.

Credit goes to Lump of Sugar for the song and the art used.

name: IndEC
desc:
One of the background music tracks from Civ3 that plays while your civilization is in the Industrial Era. When playing as a European civilization, this is also the first song that plays upon entering the Industrial Era.

You can purchase a copy of Civ3 on Steam.

Credit goes to Firaxis Games for the song and the art used.

name: 名も無き物語 / Nameless Story
desc:
The full/extended version of the title screen song from Lump of Sugar's 2010 visual novel Hello, Good-bye.

You can purchase a digital copy of the game on NekoNyanSoft's website. A few portions of the game contain adult content, so be advised. An all-ages version is available on Steam, too, at the time of writing.

Credit goes to Lump of Sugar for the song and the art used.

name: Intruder Alert
desc:
This is a legacy work. It is significantly older than my other works, and it does not have the same level of quality as my other works.

Intruder Alert from Team Fortress 2. It plays as one of the main menu songs upon booting the game, and a portion of it also plays during Valve's Meet the Spy short.

Credit goes to Valve Corporation for the song and the art used.

name: Soldier of Dance
desc:
This is a legacy work. It is significantly older than my other works, and it does not have the same level of quality as my other works.

The song that plays when using the Kazotsky Kick taunt in-game.

Credit goes to Valve Corporation for the song and the art used.

name: Megalovania
desc:
This is a legacy work. It is significantly older than my other works, and it does not have the same level of quality as my other works.

An arrangement of the song Megalovania as played during the battle against Sans in Toby Fox's 2015 indie title Undertale. This particular work is based on an arrangement made by JesterMusician.

Credit goes to Toby Fox for the song and the art used.

name: Earth Theme
desc:
This is a legacy work. It is significantly older than my other works, and it does not have the same level of quality as my other works.

One of the background tracks from the game AdVenture Capitalist. This particular work is based on an arrangement made by Keagan Fisher.

Credit goes to Hyper Hippo for the song and the art used.
